newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moroccan group says little progress for women.
newsitem.headline: Moroccan group says little progress for women.

text.p: A Moroccan human rights group said on Wednesday that women in the North African country had made little progress to end discrimination against them.
Ahead of International Women's Day on March 8, the Moroccan Association of Human Rights said in a statement that illiteracy among women remained higher than among men.
They also suffered from sexual harassment and inequality in marriage, the group said, adding that the constitution guaranteed equal political rights for both sexes but not civil rights.
The government amended legislation three years ago so that women were not forced into marriage against their will and men could not take a second wife without their spouse's approval.
The group said women were still discriminated against over divorce, maintenance and the guardianship of children.
